Personal Information

  • Debut 2002
  • Finishers Dis-arm-her, Manhandle Slam
  • Theme Song "Celtic Invasion" by CFO$

  • Spouse Seth Rollins (m. 2021)

Social Media

Biography

Rebecca Quin, better known by her ring name Becky Lynch, was born on January 30, 1987, in Limerick, Ireland. She began her wrestling training at the age of 15 and made her professional debut in 2002, initially performing under the ring name Rebecca Knox.

Lynch spent several years wrestling on the independent circuit in Europe and North America, including stints in promotions like Shimmer Women Athletes. Her career was temporarily halted in 2006 when she suffered a head injury, leading to a hiatus from wrestling for several years.

In 2013, Lynch signed with WWE and was assigned to their developmental territory NXT. She made her main roster debut in 2015 as part of the "Women's Revolution" alongside Charlotte Flair and Sasha Banks.

Lynch's career reached new heights in 2018 when she adopted "The Man" persona, becoming one of WWE's most popular superstars. This led to her headlining WrestleMania 35 in 2019, where she defeated Ronda Rousey and Charlotte Flair to win both the Raw and SmackDown Women's Championships.

After taking time off in 2020 for the birth of her daughter, Lynch returned at SummerSlam 2021. She has since remained one of WWE's top female superstars, currently holding the Women's Intercontinental Championship, which she won at Money in the Bank 2025.

Championship History

World Championships

Raw Women's Championship (4 times)
SmackDown Women's Championship (4 times)
Women's World Championship (1 time)

Other Championships

Women's Intercontinental Championship (1 time, current)
Women's Tag Team Championship (1 time)
NXT UK Women's Championship (1 time)

Accomplishments

  • First WWE Women's Grand Slam Champion
  • First WWE Women's Triple Crown Champion
  • Women's Royal Rumble winner (2019)
  • First woman to win a WrestleMania main event
  • WWE Year-End Award for Female Superstar of the Year (2018, 2019, 2022)
  • WWE Year-End Award for Match of the Year (2018, 2019)
  • Slammy Award for Superstar of the Year (2020)
  • Slammy Award for Female Superstar of the Year (2019, 2020, 2023)
  • PWI Woman of the Year (2018, 2019, 2022)
  • PWI ranked #1 in the PWI Women's 100 (2019, 2022)
  • Wrestling Observer Newsletter Most Charismatic (2019)
  • Wrestling Observer Newsletter Most Popular Wrestler (2018, 2019)
  • Sports Illustrated Wrestler of the Year (2018)
  • CBS Sports Female Wrestler of the Year (2018, 2019)
  • ESPN Women's Wrestler of the Year (2018)

Career Highlights

June 2025

Money in the Bank 2025

Defeated Dakota Kai to win the Women's Intercontinental Championship.

April 2024

WrestleMania XL

Defeated Rhea Ripley to win the Women's World Championship.

August 2021

SummerSlam 2021

Made a surprise return after maternity leave, defeating Bianca Belair in 26 seconds to win the SmackDown Women's Championship.

April 2019

WrestleMania 35

Defeated Ronda Rousey and Charlotte Flair in the first-ever women's WrestleMania main event to win both the Raw and SmackDown Women's Championships.

January 2019

Royal Rumble 2019

Won the Women's Royal Rumble match, entering at #28 and last eliminating Charlotte Flair.

August 2018

SummerSlam 2018

Turned heel after losing to Charlotte Flair, beginning "The Man" persona that would catapult her to superstardom.

July 2015

WWE Main Roster Debut

Debuted on the main roster as part of the "Women's Revolution" alongside Charlotte Flair and Sasha Banks.
